content: start by sewing the head and body together since both parts ended with the same number of stitches you should have no trouble getting them to fit perfectly page 7 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com then i sewed on the ears just below the level of where i had put the eyes i like to sew the arms on next i put them on each side about 2 row below the neck page 8 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com next come the legs i wanted the baby to be able to sit down so i made the tops of the legs flat and sewed them between row 3 & 4 of the body but i recommend you put them between row 4 & 5 so she s less likely to tip backwards the legs are all sewn on then i used black yarn to give her a big smile i like to separate 4 ply yarn into 2 strands and use that to do facial features page 9 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com and here are more finished pictures have fun page 10 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
